intro: Lampranthus promontorii, commonly known as the coastal candleplant, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt exposure. Its flowers, which range in color from red to orange, attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Lampranthus promontorii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
